alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 10:40AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...SCATTERED MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS CAUSING BRIEF VISIBILITY REDUCTION... Snow showers continue to track across portions of far eastern Ohio, the northern West Virginia panhandle, and portions of southwest Pennsylvania south of Pittsburgh. Some of these snow showers are creating brief periods of moderate to heavy snow, and will continue to track southeastward across the region through noon. Visibility of below one-half mile may be observed in the heavier snow showers. Also, a quick coating of one-half to one inch may be received, which could cause untreated roads to become snow- covered. If you are driving this morning, be prepared for low visibility and slippery roads. Slow down, allow for extra travel time, and increase the distance between your car and those that surround you
